posts.title: Fintechs’ Action
posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.text:
Fintechs’ action is everywhere and both banks (e.g. Emirates NBD news today) and SI firms (e.g. Accenture) playing ‘Orchestrator’s role providing ‘platforms’ for Fintech firms to experiment their products / ideas and take it to the next level. Should we think in similar lines and build an ecosystem of start-ups /fintech’s around us connecting with our clients? How can we expand AIE concepts to specific domain areas?
  • Barclays building 43 Blockchain apps in Innovation labs
  • DBS providing 5000 sq. ft. of co-working space
  • ANZ CEO’s vision to be a disruptor, asking Fintech’s to contact directly

posts.title: Connected Insurance
posts.name: Fintech, Blockchain
posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.text: ‘Connected Insurance’ is becoming popular embracing infinite possibilities through IoT. If we map it to our Digital /MIT framework, we can see its applicability in all three areas - customer experience (new devices, mHealth apps), Operational efficiencies (shorter claims cycles) and new products / services (“Pay as you Drive”?).  How do we position ourselves with firms like ROC-Connect providing cloud based IoT platform for Insurers?

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Accenture and Fintech
posts.text: Is it worth noting Accenture’s investment in Vlocity to build vertical solutions on Salesforce platform or its investments in building Fintech Innovation Centres across globe? (till date 59 start-ups, $200 worth funding raised and 29 FS institutions have participated)

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Blockchain
posts.text: We keep hearing about this technology and very quickly Banks are seriously attempting to understand its implications. Today we hear in the news that the R3-led blockchain consortium of the world’s biggest banks has completed their second known proof of concept experiment of blockchain technology with trials spanning five different blockchain solutions. Forty of the world’s biggest banks that are partners in the private blockchain consortium led by New York-based blockchain-tech startup R3 have tested distributed ledger systems from five blockchain vendors as well as three cloud providers. Keen to add this as a priority into our plan to explore this technology further and understand specifics of POCs being attempted by our clients.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Nina4airbnb
posts.text: You might have heard about this a while ago, but thought of sharing it.  Resume of Nina for a job at airbnb. A best example of showing client intimacy and passion. This is how she caught CEO’s attention http://www.nina4airbnb.com/

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Social Listening
posts.text: Playing on social media analytics, if I apply same query on both Capgemini and Accenture, filtered by same keywords Digital, Cloud, Disruption and Innovation….we see the following charts. Interesting to see Accenture brand appearing smaller than Digital brand for them and its reverse for Capgemini.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Ecosystems
posts.text: Ecosystems: Most commonly used term in the recent times. Undoubtedly there is a realisation that in the new world we need to build ecosystems. But how? …Few options to consider: a. Industry ecosystems – where a trend is embraced by various industry partnerships e.g. Home Energy Management ecosystems are being formed which will have energy companies, telcos, Insurance providers and SI partners. I would refer to it as ‘non-traditional FS’ partnerships  b. Solution partners ecosystem:  i.      Traditional partners with disruptive solutions e.g. IBM BlueMix ii.      Born in the cloud partner ecosystems e.g. Salesforce and AppXchange product partners  iii.      Start-ups (Fintechs)   iv.      Combination of the above  Challenge for us is to figure out how we build new ecosystems that will generate profitable business at the same time does not dilute our own value propositions. Over time we shall build (or identify) integrated solutions with these ecosystem of partners, whereby ‘collectively’ we have better offerings. Additional challenge is to look at alliance management function, it might be based on integrated solutions or a domain area than just individual product partnerships?

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Bi-model IT
posts.text: Bi-model IT:  Everyone (clients) understands the concept of “two speed IT”, but most of them are struggling to make it work.  This is an area where I see a good opportunity for SI’s like us. An integral part of Digital transformation is to make end to end IT landscape work and not just the front end or new technology solution. This means we would need Bi-Model IT operating model, support model, SLAs, APIs, services architecture and delivery methods (Agile+legacy) to work.  Will further explore with the teams on what we already have in this space to build on….

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Role of Universities/Schools in our business
posts.text: Role of Universities/Schools in our business:  “What can you tell us which we don’t know already”, common question we face from our clients (especially tier-1).  We look out for the moments where we can ‘wow’ them. In reality it’s becoming difficult. Given public access to information and many a times we feel clients are ahead or at least pretend to be ahead in the game.  One of the channels to explore is “Universities”. I have seen a huge shift in Universities in researching and developing some of the most advanced topics. In the past our interactions were mostly limited to hiring or a specific joint research…Is there anything more we can do, primarily from a Financial Services standpoint? A few thoughts:  a.       Sharing research topics of interests  b.      Participating in advisory boards and co-located trainings  c.       Partnerships on POCs, POVs  d.      Resource sharing and talent acquisition, through brand building. E.g. guest lectures etc.   e.      Inviting them in our key clients, advisors and internal events I would use CTO community to sign up to key advisory boards and look out for a network of Universities and research institutes to help us drive this future thinking? Another trend associated to Universities is closely working with senior schools and under grads. I would recall a presentation from high school principal and students in our lab who demonstrated some fascinating prototypes developed by students. Potential for us to learn from Gen Y on a regular basis?

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Regulators
posts.text: There is increasing pressure on our clients to ‘partner’ with regulators than seeing them as obstacles in the Fintech world and in the interest of consumers.  We should have a mechanism to understand regulations at all levels on an ongoing basis and host / facilitate forums to bring in clients and Fintechs to interact with regulators.  This might be geo specific but gives us an upper hand to have meaningful conversation on this subject in the areas of data privacy, cloud and at least understand challenges and how regulators are preparing for the future.  Particularly deep dive conversation on data security and privacy when we discuss cloud, APIs and CRM areas.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Social media ‘influencers’
posts.text: Social media ‘influencers’:  We are commonly used to advisors and analysts in our business but going forward there might be a need engage social media influencers more actively. We need to look into themes and identify individuals who are well known in social media (blogs, Instagram, twitter, Face book etc. based on parameters like Klout score) and engage them. With digital marketing spend taking a major share of most of client’s organisations, our social brand might be as equally important as our solution and value propositions….particularly if we need to build relationships with Fintech’s?

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Is Fog computing the future of cloud?
posts.text: As the future of sensors and IoT dominates, organisations like CISCO and solidifying on ‘Fog and Edge’ computing concepts. Cloud as it stands today might not be sufficient as the storage and compute needs to be near the sensors or edge. E.g. Driverless car can create massive amounts of data that need not be stored. Similarly in financial services a regulatory breech can be caught more quickly when analysis occur at source?

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Influence from other industries
posts.text: Just wondering if there is a need for us to understand top 2-3 trends from other industries to have closer influence on Financial Services clients. E.g. Retail for customer experience and loyalty? Other ways to look into is impact to our business from other industry trends e.g. Telco’s investment in Healthcare, Energy companies investments in smart home.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Partnerships between banks
posts.text: Got a chance to meet up with Commonwealth Bank to see next wave of innovation. Representatives from RBS and RBC are in CBA to look at Digital Innovation……Is this the future where we start to see unusual partnerships to face disruption? Next week more to learn from another innovative bank ING…

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Future of APPS
posts.text: It’s predicted that the ever growing world of Apps is likely to come down over time with rise of ‘intelligent BOTS’ and new channels of user interfaces like voice.  Interesting to note that average number of Apps used per person per month is steady around 26 since last 3 years. Our recent studies on KORE and similar products and interests from our clients validates the same.  In addition, as Satya Nadella says “Human language” is the new interface. Amazon Echo (Alexa) is a good example of what voice based interface can do (e.g. CapitalOne POC)   It’s worth looking at clients and partnerships where we can have focussed conversation and POV on “world of new user interfaces”, and potentially strengthen our Omnichannel architecture.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Tech Savvy client executives
posts.text: ING’s CXO session, CBA executive profiles and many more to count….it’s evident that senior executives of financial services organisations are becoming quite hands on when it comes to technology conversations. Many of them are capable of speaking at a granular (Java class, API, protocol) levels and like to interact with software engineers directly. Financial services organisations realises that technology is driving disruption, innovation and new business models and to compete or collaborate with Fintechs and large technology players it’s important not just having an awareness but also deep insights.  Whilst 2015 results shows only 6% of overall board members of financial services organisations are tech savvy (in the US it was 16%), overall its growing at a rapid pace. Does this mean more software engineers presenting our proposals to CXOs in future? Does this mean we should train a set of talented engineers the soft skills required to play these roles?

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: ADM business
posts.text: Significant shift and changes are expected to continue in Applications Development and Maintenance business. New ADM portfolios should be looked in conjunction with latest, disruptive technologies, speed and agility of Digital transformation.  Future of applications are designed for Digital, hosted on cloud, tightly coupled with data all intended to drive end customer experience.   Whilst any software that runs in production needs to be Maintained, increased number of releases, services based architecture, DevOps techniques will challenge the ways in which maintenance contracts will have to be negotiated…Organisations having existing multi-year contracts are looking into:• Portfolio mix overtime, movements to Digital and its impact • Current governance setup, particularly situations where we have separate Dev and Maintenance vendors• Proactively involved in cloud migration, customer experience projects to safeguard future revenue.  Situation is favourable for us to challenge the value of existing maintenance contracts run by our competitors…..To be consistent with messaging around ADM trends, we have mapped top-5 trends to our own TechnoVision blocks, along with on tools, impacts and examples. Attaching the same herewith.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Omnichannel
posts.text: Inspiring video of ING’s recent 24 hour Hackathon in Netherlands 400 Participants and 61 ideas to build the Omnichannel bank of the future….our teams participated as well https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=29Y_POE8tuw Our clients in financial services are continuing to invest and organise these events and thereby bringing innovation to life and motivating / attracting talent…

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Social Media
posts.text: Organisations continue to support and encourage participation through social media. See the attached letter of recognition from Tata’s….not sure if it makes sense to print a signed letter for supporting social media, but good concept to encourage participation

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Digital Transformation for Employees
posts.text: Employee Engagement in the Digital world: With our clients focusing on “outside in” and “customer centricity,” it’s imperative not to downplay the engagement and empowerment of employees. Research shows successful organisations are the ones who have given equal importance to customer and employee transformation.  I was surprised to see case studies that was presented in APAC meet relating to employee engagements and collaboration in the Digital World. Is there a bigger market for Digital transformation for employees that works on KPIs around attracting and retaining talent? Accenture’s paper on workforce of the future provides some good insights on this topic as well….A few points to consider a.       A new portfolio of solutions on Human Capital Management? Or ability to build Digital platform around them  b.      Providing services to clients on Gamification (e.g. Claims process in insurance), new generation training through VRs, recognitions based on Coins? (I do recall banks now providing social media training like using Linkedin etc. to all client facing staff, as part of induction)

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Microsoft and Artificial Intelligent
posts.text: Continuing the series on interesting video clips, thought of sharing the one below: • Microsoft entering into AI and Cognitive space https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R2mC-NUAmMk  (SFDC now calls out Microsoft as their biggest competitor!)

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: AirBnB and Blockchain
posts.text: It’s heard that AirBnB is now hiring blockchain specialists to build identity management solution, this is in line with our discussions and thinking around potential SI play for identity management solutions on block chain.  http://www.americanbanker.com/news/bank-technology/airbnb-hires-a-blockchain-team-in-possible-identity-play-1080440-1.html

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Fintech pitch night in Australia
posts.text: Thought of dedicating this week to Fintechs!!!!     We had an amazing Fintech pitch night in Australia. We had five interesting Fintech’s selected based on our business priorities  • Airwallex – Cross border payments• Proviso - Real time bank statements, and the winner!!! Of pitch night. • TruePillars – online marketplace for business and investors• Dragonbill – real time next generation payment platform• SmartBit – Bitcoin-blockchain explorer and smart paymentCTO community is happy to support similar pitch nights in other geographies. We should do it by H1.  It’s a good example of building ecosystem where we have regulator, Bank, fintech, consulting firms coming together.  A few extracts from the event:  Insights from Capgemini: Andrew Lai, Founder – Fintech Melbourne and FinancialAsk, took the stage to introduce Capgemini’s Manoj Khera, Head – FS, Australia and New Zealand. Manoj went on to deliver the keynote, where he spoke about new business models, new products and services in the start-up and financial industry. Discussing Innovation and Regulatory Compliance The event kicked off with an expert panel discussion featuring insights from Deborah Ralston from ASIC, Ben Heap from H2 Ventures, Todd Reichmann from NAB Labs and Capgemini’s Fs CTO, Sudhir Pai. The panel discussed the Australian Government's newly announced 'regulatory sandbox', aimed at reducing the time fintech start-ups spend navigating complex industry regulations and providing a sandbox to test new ideas.  The Social Circuit No one anticipated that we would have the #2 trending hashtag in Australia that night! With over 600,000 reached through the event tweets, you can get all the event details. Just search for @fintechmelb, @capgemini_aust and #cgfintech.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: AWS’s Cloud Adoption Framework
posts.text: Got a chance to deep dive into AWS’s Cloud Adoption Framework. In a way it appears AWS is executing our work in helping clients to increase the rate of cloud migration, ensuring ROI of cloud migration and support managed services.  The framework covers business perspective, Operations, Process, Security, People etc. and have methods like “lift and shift”, “Build it and they will come” etc. We have seen similar consulting engagements from others like Salesforce running IGNITE process. It appears that technology firms are overlapping into structured consulting space (than just professional services) and it will only increase with large ecosystem of niche, small partners that they are building.  Another interesting observation from AWS event is their top-5 engagements in the region are supported by companies we haven’t heard of e.g. Sourced, ITOC etc.  This is impacting awards as well. E.g. ITOC was “Customer Obsessed Partner of the year globally” More start-ups are coming in ‘Cloud and DevOps’ space, is it worth looking at stronger alignment, preferably acquisitions?

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Infosys and Artificial Intelligent
posts.text: Time for our own Robotics & AI platform? – Infosys today launched ‘Mana”, an AI platform designed to help customers automate repetitive system maintenance tasks and build knowledge about the underlying systems using artificial intelligence and machine learning. Accenture announced partnership with Splunk to build ‘intelligent automation systems’. We already have a number of initiatives in this area, POV papers, tools UI path partnerships etc. (including BPO)…worth collectively launching a platform something in the lines of ”roboCap”, Capgemini’s robotics and AI platform? A combination of machine learning with robotics automation can be a differentiator and applicable to most of our ADM, infra and testing work.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Convergence and hybridization
posts.text: I am convinced that we cannot look at Blockchain, API, Fintechs, Bots and other presentations in isolation as World is likely to move to ‘Convergence’ and ‘hybridization’ quickly.   As we support on premise and cloud environments today, we might support centralized and decentralized business (Blockchain) parts for our clients in near future. If I try to sum up various presentations and focus areas, here is how applying for a loan might look like in future….. 1.       Me: Hi Kora (or Cap bot) I am buying a new home can you please check with mortgage options? a.       Supported by our Digital /BPM practice, runs enterprise BPM process for origination that we recently moved to cloud and supporting on PaaS model 2.       Kora: Hey I have explored all options and based on analysis of your personal data, preferences and what happened last time, I am suggesting you go for crowdfunding through a FintechX a.       Data and Analytics practice, AI platform that we recently built for a bank b.       APIs available to connect FintechX with Bots and enterprise back-ends through API practice 3.       Me: Thanks Kora, do you need anything from my side like ID documents etc.? 4.       Kora: No we have your ID registered  in blockchainX, will use it.  a.       Our blockchain practice supports IDM process 5.       Kora:  By the way you can use ‘MoveBots’ to help re logistics! And pay directly using either Bitcoins or Dollars a.       Our partnership with logistics firms and FintechY, through cross sector collaboration 6.       Me:  Great, with the projected repayments, do I have provision for a holiday this year? 7.       Kora: Yes off course, list shows your preference is Disney land? Shall I explore? DisneyBot can help with Wearables that are programmed for you and family to stay, and game /rides. 8.       Me: That’s great! 9.       …. Convergence of Internet of Things (IoT) Internet of Money (Cryptocurrency) and Internet of Value (exchanges), will be an interesting space to watch ….

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Cybersecurity
posts.text: Almost every bid response, client conversations we end up answering questions around Cybersecurity, Information Security, and Data privacy areas.  With IoT, APIs and disruptive technologies like Blockchain focus on Cybersecurity is going to increase drastically.   At a group level we have Cybersecurity practice (launched a year ago), that provides three broad areas of coverage - cybersecurity consulting and audit services, security protection services and large scale security monitoring services. Each of these areas has set of offerings, partnerships and regional flavours.  IBM is launching Watson platform to cater to cybersecurity through cognitive computing of security data. We have seen huge investments from HP in this space. Singapore EDB provides additional benefits for hiring consultants to work on cybersecurity research projects. Whilst there are many definitions and classifications, basically they all cover cybersecurity through network, security ops, end points, apps, data and IDM areas. This is indeed a broad area and cuts horizontally across many of our offerings, Is it worth looking at it more holistically? I have bit more background on this subject happy to discuss and work on next steps…

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Spire
posts.text: A wearable called Spire can help with stressful situations. It has been there in market for a while recently got good reviews and ratings. Concept is backed by over 7 years of research from Stanford University’s Calming Technology Lab, to understand state of mind. We can wear it inside our belt. https://www.spire.io/

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Jack Dugan visit in Australia
posts.text: This week, It was great to have Jack Dugan joining us for a few interesting meetings themed on ‘ecosystems’. We caught up with companies focus on AI and machine learning, Bitcoin-Blockchain, University research areas, and views from CXO advisor.  Key callouts: 1.       Buying patterns from clients is changing, increasingly focusing on ‘productivity’ and ‘predictability’ than only cost dimension. University professor gave couple of examples of how they measure productivity of the teams and apply some clear rules on day to day ways of working. E.g. every member of the team produces status report only if there is ‘a tangible outcome’ produced during the week, else status report will appear blank and builds peer pressure to produce something every week.  2.       Interesting to note advancements in machine learning and analytics. BigML provides Data science as a service in addition to software platform, backed up some of the top scientists. Digital Autopsy was another growth area, where the companies are looking at collecting and analysing data from birth to death, and use it for legal, research, educational purposes. 3.       Building sector (sub sector) specific solutions on blockchain appeared as next big bets. We saw an example of it for Freight management.  4.       Universities are continuing to research in Natural Language processing areas (NLP), eventually predicting there will be an NLP for a client with entire client specific transaction and vocabulary being considered. Similarly on customer experience side research continues on building profiles for each and every individual customer thereby targeting offerings mapped to lifecycle events.  Areas we picked up for potential next steps: 1.       Connecting BigML to broader community to understand the product and opportunities – Health, Insurance and BPO areas.  2.       Look at sub-sector specific blockchain solutions e.g. KYC, and have a unique R3 type positioning for that solution globally. Will connect with Nilesh and Bart. On a lighter note, new business models are continuously evolving across all verticals. Recently I observed an indoor playground appear very differently during weekend with lots of ‘inflatable games’ attracting 200+ kids, generating new source of revenue.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Group CTO network meeting
posts.text: It was a great opportunity to spend time with group CTO network chaired by Lanny. A number of topics of interests were discussed, including some interesting external vendor presentations. Summary: 1.       Business Services: DEX (Delivery Excellence and Innovation) lab in Poland has built an impressive end to end (Define-Measure-Analyse-Improve-control) lean six sigma method towards continuous improvements.  Each phase has a tool like iPortal, PROMPT, iShare, tracking ideas to implementation. Standout is our ability to capture every min of ‘productivity’ of resources on the job.  • Takeaway: Worth having a look at productivity measures and applicability 2.       RPA: In the previous weeks there were email exchanges on this topic; Business Services team has really some good use cases and artefacts built.• Takeaway: Worth having a look at Zurich case study more closely. Whilst RPA from business services is specifically focusing on desktop automation at the moment, this can be extended to other processes and SDLC (IT operations) (ref: conversation with Pitchai and Ashish). RPA stream will have impact on headcount3.       My Workspace: IS team, in collaboration with Citrix has built a solution around ‘Digital employee’ experience. Similar to ACE, but the solution also provides support to new devices and channels (My Support). Futher, team is exploring a product called OctoBlue (now part of Citrix) that will bring in IoT integration as well. • Takeaway: We can look at Workspace and Digital employee conversation in IS deals as a differentiator?4.       Contract Compliance and Optimisation:  A platform has been built based on sirionlabs. This helps to bring in key contract data with finance data, delivery data to directly report out SLAs and constantly monitor progress. In most of the ADM engagements contract tracking is manual and can be cumbersome.   • Takeaway: We can look at one pilot engagement (first internally) to see the benefits. 5.       ODIGO: It’s interesting to see future roadmap of Odigo product both for customer care and service desk use cases. Odigo Suite will have lots of new features including NLP, Biometric, Sentiment analysis and open architecture platform supporting API (cloud communication and data analytics) based integration • Takeaway: Worth having a look at all new features and assess its implications in current and new engagements. On other note,1.       Please see attached blog by Rachael Stormonth from Nelson Hall “Capgemini Looks to U.S. for Makeover as it Prepares for 50th”, 2.       It’s worth having a closer look at KNIME, an analytics (open source) platform. This is a 20 member company that has captured leadership position in Gartner magic quadrant with some impressive client base and use cases.  (https://www.knime.org/)

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Future of Bank branches
posts.text: On one side we have seen banks closing many of their traditional branches and on the other side showcasing their innovation and technology leadership by opening up new “Digital branch”, Future of banking branch”, “Model branch”.  It might be worthwhile for our teams to visit these new branches at various locations and have firsthand experience of it.  It can help us building confidence when we speak to clients, or during Orals where we can refer to such recent visits. A few common themes that I picked up from visits: •         More technology, less people. Fully sophisticated ATMs, smart machines…. •         Collaborative workspace and interactive dashboards…. •         Full loaded self service centres, access to all apps and product portfolios….•         Ecosystem: Few branches now have access to other Apps like Stock market, property market etc. trying to go beyond just their own product portfolios…. •         Education sessions: At some places we have the ability to join and listen (every 1-2 hours for 30mins) topics of consumers interest e.g. Superannuation…..I hear some of our competitors e.g. TCS has a bank-branch to showcase ‘day in a life’ scenario. Upon entry they will print a ‘card’ and use it to perform various transactions within the branch!!!! Some of other our competitors e.g. Deloitte are sponsoring small part of such a ‘Digital Future branch’ e.g. Twitter wall!!! ……Seems like brilliant ideas!!!Having said that there is a counter argument that banks are wasting too much money in building these ‘future bank branches’, and with over 66% of global population online by 2020 there might be more mobile and online only banks…..than such a need for digital technology flashy branches …

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Platforms! Platforms! And Platforms!
posts.text: A buzz we hear all the time. Means different to different people at different time. Maybe it’s time to expand our definitions around it. You might have seen recent article on HBR https://hbr.org/2016/04/pipelines-platforms-and-the-new-rules-of-strategy  in summary •          Owners of platform, controlling the IP e.g. iOS•         Providers like mobile devices built on these platforms•         Producers who creates offerings like Apps on platforms•         And Consumers or users of these offeringsConcept can be expanded to Enterprises like Banks and Insurers where corporate/central function owns the IP?, branch / geographies uses this platform to build localised versions of product /services, producers (or fintechs) can build Apps / APIs on them…..  Space to watch and explore….

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Natural Languages
posts.text: Last week again I saw quite a few new organisations focusing on Natural Language (NLP) based offerings, providing “Digital Self Assist” functions.  This area is definitely picking up. It suggests that in future all I have to do is ask “Alexa” or “Kora” or “Cortana” or “Siri” to help me to pick a topic that’s of interest for our business during the week or in a quarter….:))

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: X3 device from HP
posts.text: Very interesting development where HP claims to have combined PC’s power and productivity, tablet’s portability, and smartphone’s ease of use.  Couple of possibilities for us: o   We can look at is our “My Workspace” solution from IS practice and make it to operate on HP virtualisation platform, extend to HP devices /X3 (Digital for employees) o   Potential for us to partner in X3 rollouts

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Driving Innovation Internally
posts.text: Listening to our competitors, Accenture CTO provides a view on how they are driving innovation internally within their organisation. Four key steps (http://www.zdnet.com/article/cxotalk-technology-innovation-advice-from-accentures-cto/) o   Accenture research for thought leadership o   Accenture labs, 7 R&D labs  o   Accenture Ventures, invests in start-ups o   Accenture studios to ideate and co-create

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Fourth Industrial Revolution
posts.text: There are ongoing debates on impacts of fourth industrial revolution, opportunities and challenges. The article below sets the context nicely and might be helpful when we have strategic conversations with CXOs.  https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2016/01/the-fourth-industrial-revolution-what-it-means-and-how-to-respond/

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: SIRI
posts.text: Apples announced iOS10 at WWDC and as expected enhancements to ‘SIRI’ seems to be key, including opening up Siri for third party developers. General comments from the market is it lacks AI capabilities and Apple is still catching up. Looks like it’s time to have a POV on Natural Language Processing (NLP) interfaces.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Disruption
posts.text: When we talk about disruptive business models, we refer to ‘Uber’, but not to forget OLA in India and Didi in China have gained significant market share and managed to raise billions of $ in competing with Uber as local favourites.

posts.author: Sudhir Pai
posts.title: Digital Delivery Platform
posts.text: A week before we spoke about “Platforms” a term quite often carries different meaning for different people. It was amazing to see readiness of our own “Digital Delivery Platform”, which we have been referring as ADC’s (time to find a new name!). Ashish and team did a walkthrough of how ADC’s can provide a jump-start for digital programs with ready to use pre-built set of tools and technologies. Key differentiator is that the ADC will bring in people dimension and not just technology, so we have day-1 productivity assured. Something we should expand to existing ODCs, and at key onsite locations. Thanks Pitchai for the workshop on both RPA and ADCs.
